Package resources

Class GrahamAlgorithmusV2

java.lang.Object
resources.GrahamAlgorithmusV2
public class GrahamAlgorithmusV2
extends java.lang.Object
This class makes the convex hull out of a set of points, using the Graham Scan and inserts the remaining nodes in order to solve the TSP (Traveling Salesman Problem)
Author:
Anna Kaserer

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    This function determines the direction/turn from one point to another and returns the appropriate enum.

    This function returns the final distance of the generated Route

  • Method Details

    • setNodes

      public static void setNodes​(java.util.List<java.awt.geom.Point2D> points)
      This function saves the given points into the list allNodes
      Parameters:
      points - List of points which should be calculated

    • computeConvexHull

      public static java.util.List<java.awt.geom.Point2D> computeConvexHull()
      This function determines the convex hull of the given points.
      Returns:
      the computed convex hull of allNodes

    • insertNodes

      public static java.util.List<java.awt.geom.Point2D> insertNodes​(java.util.List<java.awt.geom.Point2D> convexHull)
      This function inserts the remaining nodes which are not part of the convex hull
      Parameters:
      convexHull - the convex hull which was computed by the function @see GrahamAlgorithmusV2#computeConvexHull
      Returns:
      the completed list with all nodes

    • getLowestY

      public static int getLowestY​(java.awt.geom.Point2D p1, java.awt.geom.Point2D p2)
      This function is used to determine the point with the lowest y-coordinate
      Parameters:
      p1 - First point to compare with
      p2 - Second point to compare with
      Returns:
      -1 if(p1.y lowerThan p2.y), 1 if(p1.y greaterThan ps.y)

    • sortAllNodesByAngle

      public static java.util.Set<java.awt.geom.Point2D> sortAllNodesByAngle()
      This function sorts all nodes by their angle. It determines the angle they and the lowest point make with the x-axis. If some points have the same angle they get sorted by their ascending distance to the lowest point.
      Returns:
      a sorted set of points

    • determineDirection

      public static resources.Direction determineDirection​(java.awt.geom.Point2D p1, java.awt.geom.Point2D p2, java.awt.geom.Point2D p3)
      This function determines the direction/turn from one point to another and returns the appropriate enum. In order to determine the turn we use the cross product of three points.
      Parameters:
      p1 - the start-point
      p2 - the middle-point
      p3 - the end-point
      Returns:
      the appropriate enum (defines the direction/turn)

    • getFinalDistance

      public static double getFinalDistance()
      This function returns the final distance of the generated Route
      Returns:
      final distance
